articles.title: Scientists Find The First Animal That Doesn't Need Oxygen to Survive - ScienceAlert
articles.description: Some truths about the Universe and our experience in it seem immutable. The sky is up. Gravity sucks. Nothing can travel faster than light. Multicellular life needs oxygen to live. Except we might need to rethink that last one.
articles.content:

articles.description: Comet Atlas was once shaping up to be the brightest comet seen from the northern hemisphere since comets Hale-Bopp and Hyakutake in the mid 1990’s. Now, the comet has completely ...
articles.content:
Although this comet fell apart, the event still served to teach astronomers about a process they do not often see in such detail.
This is really exciting both because such events are super cool to watch and because they do not happen very often. Most comets … [+1805 chars]

articles.author: Carly Cassella
articles.title: There's a Surprising Connection Between Dangerous Algal Blooms And The Himalayas - ScienceAlert
articles.description: A loss of snow and ice on Earth's highest mountain peaks could be driving dangerous changes in the food chains of distant coastal water, according to new research.
articles.content:

articles.title: Whoa! Comet ATLAS got brighter this week - EarthSky
articles.description: Comet C/2019 Y4 (ATLAS) was getting brighter. Then, sadly, the Hubble Space Telescope caught it apparently disintegrating. Now ... surprise. Veteran comet observer Terry Lovejoy reported earlier today that the comet is brightening again!
articles.content:
Comet ATLAS – the comet that doesn’t want to die – via Terry Lovejoy (@TerryLovejoy66 on Twitter).
Earlier this year, comet C/2019 Y4 (ATLAS) seemed to be brightening steadily. Many hoped it would become bright enough to see with the eye alone. Then suddenly… [+1693 chars]
